entities.description: Drugs that are prescribed to help a person relax or sleep.
Instances where tranquilizers are used in a way other than prescribed, including larger amounts, longer time periods, or unauthorized purposes.
Symptoms experienced when a person stops or reduces the use of tranquilizers, such as sweating, trembling, trouble sleeping, and upset stomach.
A condition characterized by the misuse of tranquilizers in the past year and associated consequences.
Difficulties at work related to tranquilizer use, such as missing work, getting demoted, or losing a job.
Issues with family or friends caused or worsened by tranquilizer use.
Loss of time or enjoyment in social, occupational, or recreational activities due to tranquilizer use.
Emotional, mental health, or physical health problems caused or exacerbated by tranquilizer use.

relationships.description: Association between tranquilizer misuse and the experience of withdrawal symptoms.
Symptoms indicating a possible tranquilizer use disorder.
Tranquilizer misuse causing difficulties at work.
Tranquilizer misuse causing issues with family or friends.
Tranquilizer misuse leading to loss of time or enjoyment in social activities.
Tranquilizer misuse causing mental health or physical health problems.
Tranquilizer use disorder relating to mental health issues.
